instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 green light, no Fan/power
threads.message:
Hey info, this mac used to turn on, but I ended up changing some components, it stopped turning on. I replaced u1950, U1900 and U8005.


PM_SLP_S0_L 0V, no pulse when SMC_ONOFF is triggered
PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L 0v, NO PULSE
PM_SLP_S4_L 0V, no pulse
PM_SLP_S5_L 0V, 31mV
PM_SLP_SUS_L 0v, 68mV
PM_PWRBTN_L 2.885V
PM_RSMRST_L 3.28V
S5_PWRGD 3.4V
PP3V3_SUS 3.32
PP3V3_S5 3.32V
PPVRTC_G3H 3.32V
PPVOUT_S0_PCH_DCPRTC 1.56V
PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 0.521V
RTC_RESET_L 3.31V
PCH_SRTCRST_L 3.31V
ALL_SYS 0V,no pulse.
PLT_RST 0V, 600mV pulse
PPbus 8.6V
pp3v42 3.4V



L7560 3.3
L7430 0V, 65mV
L7630 0V, no pulse 
L7310 0V, 53mV
L7320 0V, no pulse

threads.title: 820-00165 green light, no Fan/power
threads.message:
You've forgot to check 2 (two) RTC signals.
Also check PM_BATLOW_L and PCH_DSWVRMEN.

Please post accurate information.
How can you get 3V3_SUS and PM_RSMRST_L high, with 0V at PM_SLP_SUS_L???

threads.title: 820-00165 green light, no Fan/power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 73528, member: 682"]
You've forgot to check 2 (two) RTC signals.
Also check PM_BATLOW_L and PCH_DSWVRMEN.

Please post accurate information.
How can you get 3V3_SUS and PM_RSMRST_L high, with 0V at PM_SLP_SUS_L???
[/QUOTE]
i have the same problem
how to check this PM_BATLOW_L and PCH_DSWVRMEN.
did u mean need to test the voltage?
